content.title: Getting Here
content.description:
**[Fly to Reno-Tahoe International Airport - RNO](https://www.renoairport.com/)**

Service to Reno, Nevada is offered by major US airlines. Non-stop flights are available from New York, Los Angeles, Long Beach, San Francisco, San Jose, and Seattle. Squaw Valley is approximately a one-hour drive from Reno Airport.

**[Fly to San Francisco International Airport - SFO](https://www.flysfo.com/)**

San Francisco is the closest major international airport to Squaw Valley, direct flights are offered to San Francisco from many cities within the US, Europe, and Asia.  Squaw Valley is approximately a four-hour drive from San Francisco, it's mostly highway driving with the last hour through mountains. Historically, the best time to avoid heavy traffic is leaving Friday before noon, or after the evening commuter rush.

**[Fly to Sacramento International Airport (SMF)](https://sacramento.aero/smf)**

Service to Sacramento, California is offered by major US airlines from anywhere within the US, Europe, and Asia. Squaw Valley is approximately a four-hour drive from San Francisco, it's mostly highway driving with the last hour through mountains. Historically, the best time to avoid heavy traffic is leaving Friday before noon, or after the evening commuter rush.

**From San Francisco - 4-hour drive**

Approximately a four-hour drive from San Francisco, it's mostly highway driving with the last hour through the mountains. Historically, the best time to avoid heavy traffic is leaving Friday before noon, or after the evening commuter rush.

**From San Jose - 4-hour drive** 

Approximately a four-hour drive from San Francisco, it's mostly highway driving with the last hour through the mountains. Historically, the best time to avoid heavy traffic is leaving Friday before noon, or after the evening commuter rush.
